review_title: As a FTC graduate now I'm part of the FTC Team!
job_title: Career Services Coordinator in Kissimmee, FL
pros: As a student that graduated at FTC twice, I feel gratefully for the opportunity to work here and now be part of the FTC family. I do enjoy see all diversity, commitment, effort and hard work every staff member offer to all our students. It feels like now I can give back the same effort and commitment they offered to me when I was a student. I'm really enjoining this new experience!
cons: I don't have any Cons to share at this time

review_title: Great starter job for a educator
pros: The work week is short, 4 day work week. Part time employment is good for those who still work in their respective field of trades/businesses outside of FTC. Definitely a good place to start as a adjunct instructor. Friendly staff and everyone is willing to help if you struggle a bit to start.
cons: Communication can be slow at times. Last minute meetings can go longer than expected and can put a strain on following appointments made in the day. Some classrooms do not reflect the industry of a few programs for students who need the hands on experience.

review_title: Requires too many hours and weekends
job_title: Director of Admissions in Pembroke Pines, FL
pros: Great while training and new.
cons: No growth offered; very limited .

job_title: Student Services Coordinator in Orlando, FL
pros: A supportive direct supervisor who shared trust and created space for autonomy. Seeing students gain confidence and mastery after providing support. The camaraderie among co-workers.
cons: Upper management distrust for employees is apparent through low levels of communication and high levels of micromanaging. Impacted employees are not included in decision-making conversations. Departmental collaboration is surface-level, and leaves work siloed and students frustrated and dissatisfied. There is often a one-size-fits-all and punish-the-masses-for-the-actions-of-a-few approach. Progressive changes to increase productivity are perpetually "coming soon." There is no evidence that the company appreciates, values, or rewards hard-working, loyal employees.

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Orlando, FL
pros: The pro's are the students you get to work with
cons: Working long hours and weekends seem to be the norm

pros: Great benefits and comp package! Gives back to the community.
cons: Very fast paced with 4 week courses

pros: Great Company to Work for. Great Benefits and Over Time
cons: Nothing so far, Great Experience

pros: Great culture. Positive atmosphere. Helpful colleagues.
cons: I have not experienced any cons so far.

review_title: Run, don’t walk from this place
pros: You get paid for overtime.
cons: Extremely high expectations. No proper training or structure at all. Negative environment.

pros: - Professional - Organized - Diverse
cons: Nothing I can think of.

job_title: Financial Aid Coordinator in Kissimmee, FL
pros: Some Reasons working at Florida Technical College: -Very Helpful -Very Caring -Always there as a team -Supportive -Understandable
cons: Cons would be the work hour schedule.

pros: Rebuilding aging program. Seems progressive.
cons: Lots of language barriers. Very mee staff

pros: Great work environment and helpful leadership.
cons: Good money, could be more or better health care package

review_title: Growing within the company -Love my Job
job_title: Director of Admissions in Kissimmee, FL
pros: I have had the privilege to see for myself how Florida Technical College has grown, since I transferred from PR to FL in 2013-14. They believe in opportunity of growth within the industry, we just have to work hard and be patient. I worked my way up the latter first as an Admissions Representative to a Senior Representative to the Associate Director of Admissions and now I am excited to be a part of the corporate. Work hard and believe in your self. I am super glad that the company believes in me as well. I Love FTC!!!
cons: They have fixed many of the previous concerns that we as employees had. one of them being Flex-pay. So glad that is out of the equation.

job_title: Program Director in Pembroke Pines, FL
pros: Not Micro Managed at work
cons: Division of the classes upper/lower

review_title: Not just a job but more like a family
job_title: Financial Aid Coordinator in Kissimmee, FL
pros:
Amazing supervisors, co-workers, upper management, staff and best thing you get to help make a difference in all of our students lives and future.

More than a just job or place you work at, this is truly like coming home everyday to a family, you are treated with respect, smiles, amazing work culture, work life balance and most importantly recognized for your hard work with many possibilities of growth and advance.
cons: Computer operating system can be slow which makes it difficult to work.

job_title: Financial Aid Coordinator in Kissimmee, FL
pros: If you are looking for a home where you can make the best of your skills and surround yourself with professionals whom are smart, humble and hard working then come work for FTC college at the Kissimmee Campus because they'll receive your talent with open arms! I am so grateful I was hired because their culture and workforce are highly positive, caring and empathetic. The directors and supervisors are in constant open communication to all employees and they definitely help and motivate you to achieve your goals. As a new employee (8 months) I feel valued, heard and my work means something for my superiors. They don't hesitate to say I'm proud of you nor to accommodate you when you have personal issues going on. In terms of benefits, they provide a great healthcare plan, PTOs by seniority is extremely generous, paid holidays, a new education allowance for all employees, x1.5 paid overtime available, etc, etc, etc. I really could go on for a long time but jut apply, apply, apply! You will love the positive work environment at FTC KISSIMMEE!
cons: No complaints! I find everything favorable to my needs.

review_title: Fast Paced Job but very rewarding
job_title: Director of Student Support Services in Orlando, FL
pros: With 4-week terms the pace is REALLY fast, but administration is so very supportive and helpful. True team work environment
cons: Have to wait 6 months to a year to earn any leave, but time flies when you’re having fun

pros: I've worked at Florida Technical College for almost 5 months, and I am so grateful I was hired. The training program was thorough and the staff were patient with me as I did not have experience in this field of work. This culture is so positive, caring, and so many people have gone out of their way to help me. The Director of Admissions have so many conversations with you about what motivates you to help you achieve your goals. The company truly cares about your career and you can have a good work-life balance and they have a genuine interest to helping the students . I enjoy working in the office because it is a fun place to work. Everyone is welcoming and friendly! I would recommend working here.
cons: no cons for the company

job_title: Career Services Coordinator in Lakeland, FL
pros: Although I've previously worked 10 years in colleges/universities, working for FTC (over the last 2.5 years) has increased my product knowledge and application of higher education resources/concepts than before. This has made me more and more capable to assist our upcoming grad/graduate population with securing employment in their field of study.
cons: The college is on a month to month "wheel schedule" were we have a group of new starts and a group of graduating classes every month. Although this is more fast paced than what I was used to, it keeps me on my toes with seeking out new prospecting employers on behalf of my graduate population.

job_title: Financial Aid Coordinator in Kissimmee, FL
pros: I felt welcome since day one. The team that I worked with was excellent. We help each other without hesitation. I enjoy working with the student and the staff, and the promotions and growth are amazing.
cons: I have no comment, and I enjoy what I do and how the staff works with me.

job_title: Executive Director in Cutler Bay, FL
pros: The world is ever changing and I appreciate that FTC works to try to find solutions! I work with some great people at all levels from reception all the way up to the president!
cons: No cons come to mind

review_title: Employee Salary and Benefits Need Improvement
job_title: Student Services Coordinator in Orlando, FL
pros: good schedule, students. professional development assistance
cons: no time off, no raises

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Deland, FL
pros: The employees here are AMAZING. Very positive, personable, and enthusiastic. We are all very supportive of each other and big on being team players. When someone does a good job or needs extra encouragement, someone always steps up to the plate and we all join in to make that person know that we believe in them and they can make it happen. We really are a family here.
cons: I honestly can not think of any cons. This is a wonderful place to work. I wake up every day wanting to come to work instead of dreading it.

job_title: Career Services Advisor in Deland, FL
pros: Just like Dorothy from the Wizard of Oz said, "There's no place like home!” I have been with Florida Technical College for 10 years now and can't imagine being anywhere else. I guess it's because of FTC's strong leaders. Our leaders heart to see our students succeed is phenomenal. Their drive to see their employees grow to be the best they can be, motivates us(me) to stay in the fight even when times get hard, because the WIN.....is enchanting! Thank you FTC for making me feel at home! #FTCStrong #FTCCares
cons: There are no cons about Florida Technical College. They continue to give back to the community.

pros: One of the best locations in the city in terms of convenience, campus culture is friendly and supportive
cons: Rigors of the day require a lot of time and attention, but you cannot help but to spend the time necessary to do what is best for team and students.

pros:
fair pay
excellent benefits
rotation of schedule
near by my home
accessible and good location
cons:
work some Saturdays 
work under pressure-not for everyone
sometimes lack of communication
work 6 days
none

review_title: Excellent place to work and get treated as family.
pros: Great environment to work. Plenty of opportunities to grow as a professional. Highly recommend this company.
cons: It was great working there, no complaints.

review_title: Not a bad position to get your foot in the door for higher education.
job_title: Regional Support Services Coordinator in Orlando, FL
pros:
Much flexibility, long as you get your tasks done in a timely manner, you had much freedom to work on other programs and build relationships with students
You are very hands on with the programs of continuing education 
You are allowed to customize your role that best fits you.
cons:
The pay is low 
You work on weekends BUT have many holidays off (+PTO)
You can work 10 hours shifts depending on what's going on that day

pros: I been in the company for almost 2 years and it been a great expirience, my Dean and Executive Director had provide me with the rite tool for me to run my program seccesfully also a had grown as a professional in the company. I feel im home and all the staff and faculties make me feel like family. Thanks a lot for the support is a honor being part of the FTC family of Kissimmee
cons: I Have no complain of the company

pros: Growth , Positive environment , Support , acknowledgment , good pay
cons: Saturday shift, there's nothing else I can truly complain about . All you have to do is your job

job_title: Regional Student Support Services Coordinator in Lakeland, FL
pros:
Great Place to Develop
Family Astrosphere amongst the employees
Caring and Understanding
Work and Life Balance is awesome
cons: Can't think of any Cons,

pros: Innovative school providing diverse modalities of instruction and programs. Advance,ent opportunities and good benefits package
cons: Fast paced and competitive environment

pros:
Helping People Follow their Goal and Dreams thru Education what better than that, FTC is more than a Job is a Family 

Health Insurance 
401K 
PTO
cons: If you are a Hard Worker you wont have a problem Working for FTC

job_title: Manufacturing Technician in Oak Hill, WV
pros: Easy schedule and tasks, boss was communicative.
cons: Covid ended the job prematurely.

pros: Good schedule and nice people
cons: Benefits are not what is advertised.

review_title: Let go and no insurance, nothing from the tactful decision
job_title: Admissions Representative in Pembroke Pines, FL
pros: Lord help y’all reading this because FTC is not in your plan if you have to read this
cons: Terrible benefits and terrible pay. Go where you are respected. Isn’t that what you want and pay will arrive... :)

pros: The 4 day work week is nice. Fellow faculty is passionate about what they do. Holidays off.
cons:
Nepotism runs deep in the entire company. I've worked for the company for more than half of a decade. They have never given a raise to any employee, actually cut most of the instructors pay when they took away overload pay. The culture is great... if your Hispanic. The more you produce the more they demand. If you don't produce, they don't demand more, nor do they give you repercussions. If you're an "untouchable" then you won't get fired. 
They will constantly threaten you with your job and micromanage you. Management is extremely unorganized and many of them are not qualified to do their jobs are are very unaffective leaders. 

The benefits suck! 401K is a joke, Health benefits are 50% of my paycheck.

They say they aren't approved to give raises supposedly. But the upper echelon of the company has the ability to use the corporate account to get a rental car of their choice at anytime. making it unnecessary to own a vehicle. Meanwhile we as employees who are higher educated are driving around on bald tires and not able to afford to feed our families.


With the new Govt. Regulations and ACICS being debunked I give this school 1 year before they are closed for good.

review_title: Be cautious, high demand sales position, non traditional overtime compensation (NOT!) for hourly personnel.
pros: Change people's lives, driven co workers
cons:
Upper management has no consideration for you as a person and even less about your family.  They spontaneously want you to work weekends and decide when during the work week you would cut hours to prevent overtime at their convenience.  Threatening people to meet goals, up on meeting it,  a new goal is placed and again informed if the new goal is not met you will have to work on Saturday.  No kudos or benefit to ever meeting any goal.  Never get to enjoy the legal holidays,  ....they use threatening tactics to make you feel you have to work Saturday or stay late in other days to "makeup" that time off.
Constant changes in policies regarding orientation for students and how it affects your work hours.

review_title: Finally a place I could grow
pros: I consider myself an ambitious person.  I really take pride in my work.  Prior to coming to FTC I was maxed out in my previous company  with little room for growth and I was just another number to management despite years of dedication and exceeding expectations.  I then started at FTC and their parent company and I noticed right away that there was more attention payed to the individual.   Management saw my potential  and really encouraged me to grow and even went out of their way to foster that growth.  I can say I have met so many mentors while working here.  So many people I look up to based on their leadership and support. I would not be where I am today if it was not for FTC.  I continue to grow both personally and professionally due to my time here and I look forward to many more years to come.
cons: Some processes are in the middle of being streamlined which leads to delays in some things.

pros:
I have been working for FTC for over 12 years.  I have experienced first hand the growth and improvement our school has taken in the last three years and I am pleased with the overall direction of our company.    

The school is student centered.  Students are heard and changes are implemented when their concerns are brought forward.  This is driven by our President who holds town hall meetings with students to personally meet with students and obtain their feedback.

Leadership development is a priority.  Our Senior Leadership team hosts an annual leadership summit, that is then followed up by year-round training for employees in leadership positions as well as employees that have demonstrated leadership potential.

Employee benefits have improved year over year and I am thankful for the most recent change that has led to lower health care premiums for our employees.

I recommend FTC without hesitation.
cons: There are no issues that I feel are negative.

pros:
Is a fast growing institution that is headed in the right direction with their on-ground and online higher education. Deans and Program Chairs are available for students at all times to hear their concerns or just to provide them with academic advisement.
Since I've started with FTC I could say that I enjoy coming to work.  Employees are appreciated and your work doesn't go unnoticed. I am proud to be part of a team that thinks about incorporating technology into their every day to help improve and facilitate all the processes that we do for our students so that they get anything they need at an earlier time.
cons: No Cons at the moment.  Every aspect that had an improvement capability has been taken care of by the ED's, VP's and President.

review_title: Opportunities in a time of Pandemic!!!
job_title: Financial Aid Coordinator in Kissimmee, FL
pros: Recently, "adversity" and "unemployment" have become the new most common words due to the COVID-19 pandemic, but at FTC "hope" and "opportunity" have become my consign . FTC gave me the opportunity to continue my professional career while being able to contribute to the development of new professionals. Even though I'm a recent trainee employee, my experience has been so far excellent and I'm eager and excited to continue helping with the development of future professionals that will likely contribute to revamp the current economic panorama.
cons: The College could offer more courses and new programs since they have the expertiese, talent and capacity to do it.

pros: Benefits begin after 30 days
cons:
1) favoritism, you will find this issue in every job, but here you can actually see it,  the movie "mean girls" has nothing on what you see at FTC. 
2) broken promises- the leads that they provide are non-functioning lead, and the president expects numbers on a weekly basis, as a punishment if you do not meet those numbers, you will need to work on the weekend (force to work) even if you have a flight, doctors appointment, you will get fired or written up. No one dares to speak up, afraid of getting fired. There is constantly an issue, if you excel for the week, you still are not doing your best. One gets discouraged because of the treatment from upper-management, they see you as a robot.

pros: Instructors were great with an exception of a couple. Pay was decent, unless you calculated all the at home hours you put in.
cons:
There is no room to advance in this company unless your their troll. They don’t care about the students or their employees 
It’s all about money 
They want you to pass all students through even if they can’t read or write, to keep up the schools rating. You spend a majority of your day calling, texting and emailing students begging them to come back to class. Worst CEO ever, he doesn’t talk to you, he talks at you. He actually said he doesn’t care about the students let them complain. He doesn’t care about the employees either he can replace you behind your back then let you go after all your hard work.

review_title: Quality of education is horrible. Run from this place!
pros: There are no advantages of this place.
cons: Very immature student body.  Management does not support their staff but instead there's a lot of pressure to provide "study guides" to the students which are nothing more than copies of the tests with the answers. Faculty is horribly micro-managed and the amount of paperwork that's required is off-the-charts crazy.  Many students are very lazy and expect everything to be handed to them.  The vast majority of those in my classes refused to read their books.  I would not pass anyone who did not do their work.  Some are outrageously disrespectful to the faculty.  Students are under a lot of pressure to sign for additional student loans.  This place is nothing more than a mill.  I am ashamed to even have worked there.

pros: The student experience, teaching young minds, giving back to the younger generation with knowledge.
cons: Pay is the biggest problem, Teachers have not had a raise since 2009, economics are blamed for this by administration, while they receive their pay raises and bonuses, they expect teachers to work off the clock, benefits are poor to say the least, turnover is high within staff, financial aid, admissions and most of all teachers, you have to work a split 12 hour shift, and forced to attend meetings without being compensated for attending.

pros:
Manager all work as one, there is total commitment from the faculty and staff 

Excellent team work in the Central Florida campus's  they say we are the Family that cares!
cons: Lack of corporate communication or training, lack of technical support, lack knowledge of communication to the staff and instructors from upper campus management

review_title: Truly honored to be with a company that has been able to adapt to any situation.
pros: Florida Technical College was able to ease into a distance learning modality with ease. We know that the whole world is trying to adapt to the new way of living at the moment but that did not stop FTC. Our students were able to continue they education and the staff has been able to support them 100%.  Definitely makes me feel proud to be with such a great company.
cons: No company can be perfect for everyone. However for me it has truly been an honor. They do so much for their students, employees and the community.

pros: FTC is doing a lot of great things to help both their students and employees succeed. Scholarships for eligible Hurricane Maria Victims, Honorary Scholarships in the name of slain Police Officers, scholarships for graduates etc.  From an employee standpoint, it's great to work for a company President who works as hard supporting our efforts as Dr. Burkett.  We are transitioning to regional accreditation this summer/fall and the future is very bright for students and employees going forward.  Great place to work!
cons: Working to overcome shortfalls of the previous administration.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cutler Bay, FL
pros:
While the COVID crisis could, and has, upended many colleges in the country whether for-profit, non-profit, private, public, trade, community, etc., FTC has been able to overcome  many  of the obstacles presented to them and is thriving.
FTC listens to the input and advice of their employees and makes sure everyone is in it together.
cons: No cons to report at this time.

pros: There's hustle and goals to meet daily. Management is attentive. Great team to work with. Communication is evident. The environment gives you the confidence to exceed your own expectation and theirs. Able to adjust in current "norm" with remote and onsite locations. It feels like family.
cons: None at the moment that comes to mind.

pros: Good team atmosphere. Competitive, but if you have a good Director then life will be just fine. Love helping the type of student we attract. The type of student attracted to technical college are those, generally, that have waited to attend college later in life who have low confidence in their abilities. It is our job to convince them how we can assist them.
cons: Turn over in management positions can be a problem, but if you have a good manager all is well.

review_title: FTC - Doing BIG for students and employees!
job_title: Associate Director of Admissions in Kissimmee, FL
pros: FTC - A company devoted and committed to their students and the development of their employees. Positive workplace culture. Pleasant environment for students and employees.
cons: No employer is perfect, but FTC strive for Excellence throughout continuous improvement. This is the right place to be, but only if you are a hard worker seeking for career growth.

pros: I enjoy going to work and feel supported by my supervisor.  We have a great BI team that delivers data so we can focus on what needs to be done instead of running reports.    The culture: coaching employees for future leadership positions in the company, collaborative problem solving, and open communication.   Great company to work for!
cons: Health insurance costs aren't ideal.

pros: About $2500 per month long course
cons:
An expectation professors will be available 24/7 for students by personal phone. 
Students are always right even if they attempt to cheat or plagiarize 
Late work is always accepted 
Heavy push to pass at least 75% of students. To do so instructors are encouraged to drop assignments students are not doing well in
The freshman composition course does not align with the standards for ENC 1101. Students write one essay and get six credits. 
Grammar errors written into the course 
Administration is not well organized 
Unprofessional atmosphere

pros: Academic freedom allows to give the students the best you can with what you are given.  The classes are four weeks long.
cons: It is a diploma mill.  It is all about the money and not about the students.  The pay isn't good, no way for raises or advancement.

review_title: I am a proud student of this institution
pros: The staff here are very supportive. They encourage students to reach out in their times of need and use the open door policy when it is needed.
cons: I can think of no cons

pros: Great professors & excellent team work.
cons: Not organized, takes all your money way too expensive, promises employment but doesn't care after you finish, just think it's a waste of time and money.

review_title: Don’t work here it will hurt your Career in Education
job_title: Associate Academic Dean in Orlando, FL
pros:
-Front staff is friendly. 
-Career service people are great.
cons:
I’ve worked in higher education for the past 27 years for non and for profit colleges and universities. FTC by far gives the for-profit sector a bad name. If you want to work for an institution that encompasses zero empathy for students, faculty and staff. Has poor, standards, overwhelmed leadership, staff, and instructors please read my lengthy review below. 

When I was hired out of state I was lead to believe by the FTC leadership team in the main campus in Orlando (President, Executive Director and Vice Presidents and Head Academic Dean) that FTC was growing when in reality they were actively eliminating positions company wide. A companies goal is to grow out of hard financial problems while FTC was cutting their way out of it.  I’ve worked in ethical and compliant for-profit colleges for 12 years now so I knew when I heard this it was bad news. Cutting is a desperate measure not a position anyone should come into.  I would not have moved and  taken the position if I was not lied to. 

Leadership asked me to move across the U.S and it was at a great personal expense for myself and family with no relocation assistance by FTC. Three short months after, I was told my job was eliminated. I was asked to leave immediately and was not given a severance. Just a thank you for your service.  Not a common practice in any reputable business.  Left me and my family in a sickening financial situation which were still trying to recover today.  I was also new to the state so unemployment was not an option.  

In the month I arrived FTC converted all Associate and BA programs to solely online (they were blended before). They cut all directors at their campuses over the Florida region. The dean and directors job in Orlando was to absorb all online students from all the campuses and advise these students which lead them to be overwhelmed.  The dean when I was there had a panic attack and had to go home one day. The expectation was work 7 days a week and be available 24/7.  The message from the president was that FTC is an online school and we need to service the students.  

The Executive Director was also forced to take on the job of admissions director. He lead the admissions team to fail and could not make enrollment in the 3 months I was there. The backbone of education was relayed upon with holding on to retain current students. Education made great numbers for the first two months but it was by any means necessary to keep the institution afloat.  This directive was disturbing to me as a experienced leader of academics. 

What was observed daily was no empathy for the students by directors, deans, president and the ED. There were times when students were experiencing major life issues like being in the hospital or having a death in their family only be hounded to post by online liaisons and directors.  Ill never forget one Incident where the dean and directors made jokes about having a student post in the hospital. The student just needed to post so FTC could make a retention goal. In reality the student would in hence fail and accumulate more debt. I did not find this in the best interest of the student. This practice was not ethical nor amusing. 

FTC best practices was that students were to hounded to post online If they are not being active for 4 days. No emphasis on academics or helping with life issues.  The directive was to give them some path stay a float by hook or crock. There were two paths pass or have them post.  Classes were also cut from 20 to only 18 days long so they could add to FTC’s bottom line. This accelerated schedule was not in the best interest of a first time college student. Posting was empathized the most while passing them was the latter. 

In regards to academic standards. There were many instances in my own online audits in canvas where instructors gave A grades even though there were rapid plagiarism and students didn’t follow the rubrics.  Vice Presidents, directors and the Head Dean were aware and lended a blind eye to this practice because they do not want to loose students for retention purposes.  They encouraged instructors to pass them by any means.  This is against accreditation standards. 

I also did degree audits where  I found that there were added courses in general Ed’s and electives that weren’t needed for completion of FTC’s AA and BA degrees in Criminal Justice, IT, Allied Health, MBC and Business.  These unneeded courses were added charges for the gain of the intuition and were un be known to the students. Students do not have any choices on which courses they take. It is all mapped out for them from the start. Students academic paths are preregistered. I did report this to the head dean and program director which they did nothing to correct it. This was really distressing to me to be ignored so I reported it to the FA Commissioner in Washington DC. It was unethical and wrong to these students who did not know and is huge title IV compliance violation.  Not right to add unnecessary time and debt to any student which are mostly are low income and first time college students.  

In a leadership role I spoke up in daily retention meetings and was told to stop in the pursuit on digging deeper into student issues. I was told that FTC was only interested if a student posted something. I was assured by the Head Dean that would have a another meeting weekly to dive into underlining life and academic issues  This never happened which blew my mind. 

The main focus of everyone job here is to have to students post assignments or post to discussions so FTC could get funding. I would say out on a 10 hour day at least 6 hours of your work load is based on one daily retention meeting. This entails, running a daily retention report, having a two hour daily meeting, and trying to get a hold of students to encourage them to post something.  Another part of the job is making sure attendance is posted by instructors. There is no physical registrar to over see this. I never met the registrar or seen one in person. The registrar is on a ticket system which is completely ineffective and dangerous for compliance, scheduling and oversight. 

For Training FTC boosts a leadership summit and town halls but it has nothing to do helping students or faulty. Honestly these meetings are required for training development but are a show so the president can feed his narcissism.  

Because of the issues above the faculty and staff are poorly trained. Again training and onboarding main emphasis is keeping the students by encouraging them to post. The head dean does online faculty meetings with the faculty but they are all about getting the students to post or to encourage them to pass by making exceptions. Nothing to do with enriching the students knowledge about subject matter. 

Obviously I do not have a high opinion of FTC and would not recommend it to anyone to work there.  You will be a disposable number as a leader, director, staff, instructor and most importantly a student.  The goal is only the bottom line. The goal is not to enrich lives of students or nurture your career in education.  I  know this review is a huge risk to my own reputation but I’ve taken this experience off my resume. It’s an embarrassment in itself to be aligned to this school and will hurt your career in education.  I’m sure FTC will tell you their numbers speak for themselves. With a 20% failure rate, poor retention, and 25,000 first year salary for students who grad with a 50,000 BA is despicable.  Run run run away!

pros: Very Positive changes taking place! There is a culture of support and an environment ripe for growth with opportunities to do so. Leadership is open to listen and implement changes for the good of employees and students.
cons: None. Unless you don't have a passion to help people with an opportunity to change their lives through an education.

pros: There is a large team environment. As a whole the staff is really uplifting and supportive. Whenever you have a question or need to reference anything there is always a helping hand. Lots of positivity throughout the work day.
cons:
High stress environment. If you cant handle that, then this job is not for you.
Some weekend shifts.

Overtime if needed.

pros: Pay was good. Benefits not so much. They were m not so good at disclosing 401K. Health insurance was a joke.
